channel.title: Underage drinking in Georgia..?
channel.description:
Well today at 3 am me and some other friends were locked up for underage drinking.. I was 16 when i was arrested but in 13 more days I'll be 17, but I'm being charged as a juvenile for underage drinking.
I only blew a 0.05 (which is really low for what I drank)
but I was wondering what punishment will I get?
I'm going to try to plea innocents because all the cops know we drank koolaid that was spiked and it tasted just like koolaid.. But idk.

item.title: Underage drinking in Georgia..?
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“Starting up …, post:8, topic:345279”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=441656.msg3244347#msg3244347 date=1277223345]
lool 0.05, you can drive on that here… thats nothing

sucks to be you
[/quote]
I drank 8 shots of 180 proof moonshine
2 big cups of spirit water [moonshine and vodka] and fanta
1 four loko [12.0]
and 4-5 cups of koolaid and moonshine.[/quote]
ps that’s bullshit.

Read full topic

item.title: Underage drinking in Georgia..?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I’ve seen on the tv that when you get breathalysed on the road and you blow too high they have to take you back to the station and retest you with the big non portable fucker. You have to provide two samples of breath on this big machine and if the results have a large range (like say you blew 0.88 and then 0.5) then they are required to take a sample of blood.

<3 traffic cops

Read full topic

They give you another breathalyzer, but from a big non-portable (and more accurate) one.
[/quote]

Ye a big machine like on road wars wat sky one kthaxnbia;/[/quote]I always watch that, it’s awesome!!

item.title: Underage drinking in Georgia..?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:37, topic:345279”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=441656.msg3247511#msg3247511 date=1277494588]

did yo umeasure your bac like 10 hours later? lolol
[/quote]He probably thinks you’re more tolerant to alcohol if you have a lower reading, so is trying to act cool.

Or maybe the US breathalyzers just suck dick.

US breathalyzers are usually painfully accurate ~,-[/quote]

Really? I was under the impression breathalysers are usually inaccurate and it’s up to the judgement of the cop if they take you back to a station and do a blood/urine/whatever test.

I’m not American but still, if breathalysers were accurate there wouldn’t be much of a need for reading the alphabet backwards, standing on one foot and touching your nose with your finger would there? Etc

Read full topic

item.title: Underage drinking in Georgia..?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“TR3V0R, post:17, topic:345279”][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=441656.msg3244432#msg3244432 date=1277231314]

lool 0.05, you can drive on that here… thats nothing

sucks to be you

I drank 8 shots of 180 proof moonshine
2 big cups of spirit water [moonshine and vodka] and fanta
1 four loko [12.0]
and 4-5 cups of koolaid and moonshine.
[/quote]

Must have been quite a while after you took your last drink to when you got arrested for a .05 lol.[/quote]I finished the four loko right before they got there… and we were only there for abt 2-3 hours total.

[quote=“Uriko, post:19, topic:345279”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=441656.msg3244884#msg3244884 date=1277266217][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=441656.msg3244779#msg3244779 date=1277256111]

Here you just get your drink tipped out. Well, that’s if you’re a retarded chav that drinks outside at 3am…
[/quote]Wasn’t even outside dumbass… one drunk old guy busted my friends windshield and headlights and he called the cops about that and some other dude came out that had been drinking and he Breathalyzed everyone.

So you were drinking underage and one of you called the cops? That doesn’t sound very smart, you must have been really drunk.
[/quote]
someone broke their windshield and headlights. . .

@ OP 17 is not a juvenile in georgia?[/quote]You get trialled as a adult at 17

[quote=“Cowie`, post:21, topic:345279”][quote author=Starting up … link=topic=441656.msg3244432#msg3244432 date=1277231314]

lool 0.05, you can drive on that here… thats nothing

sucks to be you

I drank 8 shots of 180 proof moonshine
2 big cups of spirit water [moonshine and vodka] and fanta
1 four loko [12.0]
and 4-5 cups of koolaid and moonshine.
[/quote]

And you’re lying.[/quote]
'sif I care what you think.

item.title: Underage drinking in Georgia..?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:26, topic:345279”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=441656.msg3245004#msg3245004 date=1277278919]
lol people actually give a shit if you’re drinking underage? happens all the time here
EDIT:

i always thought the person who gave the minor the alcohol is responsible, not the minor themselves.

I’m pretty sure that is also what happens here, in ohio at least. I was never caught for underage drinking, my advice would be to never do it outside, that’s just asking for problems.

Well, now that I think about it. Once after my friends and I were over 21 one of them brought a 20 year old girl to my house and she drank too, the cops got called and she got handcuffed, put into the back of a police car, and then let go and told not to drink anymore that night. None of us got in trouble, besides just being sent back inside, the cop even gave me the gun I was carrying (legally, I have a CCW permit) back and told me to stay inside the rest of the night. But then she was over 18 and responsible for her own actions, if she was a minor I think it would have been different.

thats so fucking retarded, its quite frequently here that people who are underage drink within a home, and the police can knock at the door but not do anything, and you see people who are underage who are quite clearly drunk some nights. Honestly your country is a bit fucked up
[/quote]

To be fair we were outside, sitting on the beds of our trucks. The only reason the police got called though is that the underage girl was on the phone with her ‘husband’ screaming at the top of her lungs. Women…[/quote]
still. People here drink underage outside and no one calls them up on it, you see teens drunk staggering around sometimes from these gay private parties that places setup so underage people can drink without being 18. And the worst the police do is take you home to your parents

Read full topic

item.title: Underage drinking in Georgia..?
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:20, topic:345279”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=441656.msg3245006#msg3245006 date=1277279506]
17 is not a juvenile in georgia?
[/quote]

In australia you can be charged at 17.[/quote]in canada you can be tried as an adult around ~17 as well if the situation necessitates it, but i believe under age drinking is hardly grounds for that =/

Read full topic
